'''Andrew R. Jassy''' (born January 13, 1968)<ref name="nuwber">{{cite web |url=https://nuwber.com/person/563a3f8205a684fe719bf84a |title=Andrew R Jassy from Seattle, WA |publisher=Nuwber|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210202223228/https://nuwber.com/person/563a3f8205a684fe719bf84a|archive-date=2021-02-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.4-traders.com/business-leaders/Andrew-Jassy-008MTZ-E/biography/ |title=Andrew R. Jassy, MBA |publisher=4-traders}}</ref> is an American business executive who is the [[President (corporate title)|president]] and [[chief executive officer]] (CEO) of [[Amazon (company)|Amazon]]. Before being appointed by [[Jeff Bezos]] and the Amazon board during the fourth quarter of 2020,<ref>{{Cite web |last= |first= |date= |title=Amazon.com Announces Financial Results and CEO Transition |url=https://ir.aboutamazon.com/news-release/news-release-details/2021/Amazon.com-Announces-Fourth-Quarter-Results/default.aspx |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210202211950/https://ir.aboutamazon.com/news-release/news-release-details/2021/Amazon.com-Announces-Fourth-Quarter-Results/default.aspx |archive-date=February 2, 2021 |access-date=February 2, 2021 |website=ir.aboutamazon.com |language=en-US}}</ref> Jassy served as the SVP and later as the CEO of [[Amazon Web Services]] from 2003 to 2021.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Andy Jassy will be the next CEO of Amazon. Insiders dish on what it's like to work for Jeff Bezos' successor who built AWS into a $40 billion business |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210202220756/https://www.businessinsider.com/andy-jassy-amazon-web-services-ceo-2021-1 |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/andy-jassy-amazon-web-services-ceo-2021-1?IR=T |archive-date=February 2, 2021 |date=31 Jan 2021 |publisher=[[Business Insider]] |last1=Eugene |first1=Kim |first2=Ashley |last2=Stewart |access-date=3 Feb 2021 |url-status=live }}</ref>

==Early life and education==
Jassy is the son of Margery and Everett L. Jassy of [[Scarsdale, New York]].<ref name="nytmar">{{Cite news|title=Elana Caplan And Andrew Jassy |language=en-US |work=The New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1997/08/24/style/elana-caplan-and-andrew-jassy.html |access-date=February 2, 2021|issn=0362-4331 |date=August 24, 1997 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210203080100/https://www.nytimes.com/1997/08/24/style/elana-caplan-and-andrew-jassy.html |archive-date=3 February 2021}}</ref> Jewish{{r|yworld}}<ref>{{Cite web|title=Amazon's next CEO Andy Jassy is Jewish|url=https://www.jta.org/quick-reads/amazons-next-ceo-andy-jassy-is-jewish|access-date=2021-02-05|website=Jewish Telegraphic Agency|language=en-US}}</ref> with [[Jasz people|Hungarian]] ancestry,<ref name=yworld>{{Cite news |title=Amazon's Next CEO Andy Jassy Is Jewish |url=https://www.theyeshivaworld.com/news/headlines-breaking-stories/1945868/amazons-next-ceo-andy-jassy-is-jewish.html |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210215104523/https://www.theyeshivaworld.com/news/headlines-breaking-stories/1945868/amazons-next-ceo-andy-jassy-is-jewish.html |archive-date=15 February 2021 |date=7 Feb 2021 |access-date=14 Feb 2021 |first1= |last1= |website=}}</ref> his father was a senior partner in the [[corporate law]] firm [[Dewey Ballantine]] in New York City, and chairman of the firm's management committee.{{r|nytmar}} Jassy grew up in [[Scarsdale, New York|Scarsdale]], and attended [[Scarsdale High School]],{{r|nytmar}}<ref>{{cite web|url=http://scarsdale10583.com/the-goods/4244-amazon-s-andy-jassy-86-to-be-interviewed-by-dr-hagerman-on-tuesday-at-8pm|title=Amazon's Andy Jassy '86 to be interviewed by Dr. Hagerman on Tuesday at 8pm|first=Adrienne|last=Fishman|date=September 11, 2014|website=scarsdale10583.com|access-date=October 12, 2017}}</ref> where he played varsity soccer and tennis.<ref name="wsj2">{{cite news |last1=Tilley |first1=Aaron |title=Amazon Primed Andy Jassy to Be CEO. Can He Keep What Jeff Bezos Built? |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-primed-andy-jassy-to-be-ceo-can-he-keep-what-jeff-bezos-built-11625218225 |access-date=12 July 2021 |work=Wall Street Journal |date=2 July 2021}}</ref>

Jassy graduated [[cum laude]] from [[Harvard College]] in government, where he was advertising manager of ''[[The Harvard Crimson]]'', before earning an MBA from [[Harvard Business School]]. In 1989, he wrote in ''The Crimson'' that the newspaper should continue to publish advertisements from [[Eastern Air Lines]], despite an ongoing [[labor dispute]] there.<ref>{{Cite web |title=No Eds in Ads {{!}} Opinion {{!}} The Harvard Crimson |url=https://www.thecrimson.com/article/1989/4/19/no-eds-in-ads-pbrbegardless-of/ |access-date=2022-04-14 |website=www.thecrimson.com}}</ref><ref name="Hook">{{cite web|url=https://www.ft.com/content/a515eb7a-d0ef-11e5-831d-09f7778e7377|title=Person of the Year: Amazon Web Services' Andy Jassy|first=Leslie|last=Hook|date=March 17, 2016|website=Financial Times|access-date=October 12, 2017|archive-url=https://archive.today/20210205200823/https://www.ft.com/content/a515eb7a-d0ef-11e5-831d-09f7778e7377 |archive-date=5 February 2021 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="bloomberg.com">{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/profiles/people/15111610-andrew-r-jassy|title=Andrew Jassy, Amazon.Com Inc: Profile & Biography|author=|date=|website=Bloomberg|access-date=October 12, 2017}}</ref>

==Career==
Jassy worked for five years after graduation before entering his MBA program as a project manager for a [[Collectable|collectible]]s company, [[Danbury Mint|MBI]], and then he and an MBI colleague started a company and closed it down.<ref name="Hook" /><ref name="auto2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.hbs.edu/forum-for-growth-and-innovation/podcasts/disruptive-voice/Pages/podcast-details.aspx?episode=15834284|title=Podcast - Forum for Growth & Innovation - Harvard Business School|website=www.hbs.edu|archive-url=https://archive.today/20210204142729/https://www.hbs.edu/forum-for-growth-and-innovation/podcasts/disruptive-voice/Pages/podcast-details.aspx?episode=15834284|archive-date=February 4, 2021|access-date=February 3, 2021|url-status=live}}</ref>

Jassy joined Amazon as a marketing manager in 1997<ref name="wsj2"/> with several other Harvard MBA colleagues.<ref name="auto2"/><ref name="Hook" /> In 2003, he and [[Jeff Bezos]] came up with the idea to create the [[cloud computing]] platform that became known as [[Amazon Web Services]], which launched in 2006.<ref name="wsj1">{{cite news |last1=Tilley |first1=Aaron |title=Who Is Andy Jassy? Jeff Bezos Acolyte Moves From Cloud to Amazon CEO |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/who-is-andy-jassy-jeff-bezos-acolyte-moves-from-cloud-to-amazon-ceo-11612309443?mod=searchresults_pos6&page=1 |access-date=3 February 2021 |work=Wall Street Journal |date=2 February 2021}}</ref> Jassy headed it and its team of 57 people.<ref name="auto"/>

[[File:Andy Jassy in 2016.jpg|thumb|right|Jassy in 2016]]
In 2016, Jassy was named Person of the Year by the ''[[Financial Times]]''.<ref name="Hook" /> A month later, Jassy was promoted from senior vice president to chief executive officer of Amazon Web Services.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://venturebeat.com/2016/04/07/andy-jassy-is-finally-named-ceo-of-amazon-web-services/ |title=Andy Jassy is finally named CEO of Amazon Web Services |last1=Novet |first1=Jordan |date=7 Apr 2016 |publisher=[[VentureBeat]] |access-date=12 October 2017 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210203123143/https://venturebeat.com/2016/04/07/andy-jassy-is-finally-named-ceo-of-amazon-web-services/ |archive-date=February 3, 2021 |url-status=live }}</ref>{{r|bloomberg.com}} That year Jassy earned $36.6 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2017/04/12/aws-ceo-andrew-jassys-2016-pay-hits-35-6-million.html|title=The most highly paid Amazon executive isn't the CEO — it's the head of cloud|first=Anita|last=Balakrishnan|date=April 12, 2017|publisher=CNBC|access-date=October 12, 2017}}</ref>

For his work as chief executive officer of Amazon Web Services, Jassy earned a base compensation of $175,000 in 2020, plus a [[restricted stock]] unit award of 4,023 shares (a value of $12,104,844.93 as of July 26, 2020<ref name="AMZNPrice">{{cite web | url = https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/AMZN?p=AMZN | title = Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) | access-date = July 26, 2020}}</ref>) of Amazon with [[vesting]] beginning in 2023. He also received a restricted stock unit award in April 2018 for 10,000 shares (a value of $30,089,100 as of July 26, 2020),<ref name="AMZNPrice"/> which vest 37.5% in 2021, 12.5% in 2022, 37.5% in 2023, and 12.5% in 2024.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://materials.proxyvote.com/Approved/023135/20200402/NPS_425478.PDF| title = Notice of 2020 Annual Meeting of Shareholders & Proxy Statement | date=May 22, 2020 | access-date = July 26, 2020 |ref=Page 55, 56, 57}}</ref>

In January 2021, Bezos designated Jassy his official successor as CEO;<ref>{{Cite web |date=November 23, 2021 |first=Avery |last=Hartmans |title=Jeff Bezos surprised Andy Jassy by picking him as Amazon CEO: VF |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/jeff-bezos-choosing-andy-jassy-surprised-amazon-ceo-2021-11 |access-date=2022-06-03 |website=Business Insider |language=en-US}}</ref> with the transition occurring on July 5, 2021.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Palmer |first1=Annie |title=first year after succeeding Bezos as Amazon CEO |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2022/07/05/andy-jassy-just-wrapped-up-a-rocky-first-year-after-as-amazon-ceo.html |website=CNBC |access-date=8 April 2023}}</ref> During his first year running Amazon, he received a pay package of $212.7 million, a substantial increase from his 2020 compensation.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Thorbecke |first=Catherine |date=April 1, 2022 |title=Amazon CEO Andy Jassy's total compensation package topped $212 million |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2022/04/01/tech/andy-jassy-amazon-ceo-pay/index.html |url-status=live |access-date=April 4, 2022 |website=CNN International}}</ref>

==Personal life==
In 1997, Jassy married Elana Rochelle Caplan, a fashion designer for [[Eddie Bauer]] and graduate of the [[Philadelphia College of Textiles and Science]], at a [[Loews Hotels|Loews Hotel]] in [[Santa Monica, California]].{{r|nytmar}}  Their wedding was officiated by New York Rabbi James Brandt, a cousin of Elana.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://meaww.com/who-is-elana-jassy-wife-of-andy-jassy-new-amazon-ceo-jeff-bezos-politcal-donation-travel-family |title=Meet Elana Rochelle Caplan, Amazon's next CEO Andy Jassy's fashion designer wife who loves traveling |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210205002707/https://meaww.com/who-is-elana-jassy-wife-of-andy-jassy-new-amazon-ceo-jeff-bezos-politcal-donation-travel-family |archive-date=5 February 2021 |website=meaww.com}}</ref> Both their fathers were senior partners in law firm [[Dewey Ballantine]].{{r|nytmar}} Jassy and Caplan have two children.<ref name="fortune15">{{Cite news |title=How Andy Jassy helped Amazon own the cloud |url=https://fortune.com/2015/06/28/andy-jassy-amazon-web-services/ |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210203192009/https://fortune.com/2015/06/28/andy-jassy-amazon-web-services/ |date=28 Jun 2015 |archive-date=3 February 2021 |access-date=23 Feb 2021 |last1=Rao |first1=Leena |publisher=[[Fortune.com]]}}</ref>

They live in the [[Capitol Hill, Seattle|Capitol Hill]] neighborhood of [[Seattle]] in a 10,000-square-foot house bought in 2009 for $3.1 million.<ref name="montgomerysummit">{{cite web |title=Andy Jassy: Amazon Web Services (AWS) CEO |url=https://www.montgomerysummit.com/speakers/andy-jassy/ |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210223073917/https://www.montgomerysummit.com/speakers/andy-jassy/ |archive-date=23 February 2021 |website=montgomerysummit |access-date=2 February 2021}}</ref><ref name="auto3">{{Cite web |url=https://www.dirt.com/moguls/tech/amazon-andy-jassy-house-santa-monica-1203344910/ |title=Amazon Web Services CEO Andy Jassy Buys Prime Santa Monica Home|first1=James|last1=McClain|date=October 14, 2020 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210223074027/https://www.dirt.com/moguls/tech/amazon-andy-jassy-house-santa-monica-1203344910/ |archive-date=23 February 2021}}</ref> In October 2020, it was reported that Jassy had bought a $6.7 million 5,500-square-foot house in Santa Monica.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sfchronicle.com/business/article/Who-is-Andy-Jassy-the-Amazon-exec-who-will-15919346.php |title=Who is Andy Jassy, the Amazon exec who will replace Jeff Bezos as CEO?|first=Susie|last=Neilson|date=February 2, 2021|website=San Francisco Chronicle |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210223074147/https://www.sfchronicle.com/business/article/Who-is-Andy-Jassy-the-Amazon-exec-who-will-15919346.php |archive-date=23 February 2021}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://therealdeal.com/la/2020/10/14/a-top-amazon-exec-buys-in-santa-monica/ |title=Amazon's Andy Jassy Buys Santa Monica Home|date=October 14, 2020|website=The Real Deal Los Angeles |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210204165502/https://therealdeal.com/la/2020/10/14/a-top-amazon-exec-buys-in-santa-monica/ |archive-date=4 February 2021}}</ref><ref name="auto3"/>

He is chairman of Rainier Prep, a [[Charter schools in the United States|charter school]] in Seattle.<ref>{{cite web |title=Board |url=http://www.rainierprep.org/board/ |access-date=October 12, 2017 |publisher=Rainier Prep}}</ref>
